children.name: annals
children.definition: formal biên niên sử
examples: 1 in the annals of sthin the whole history of sth :

children.name: one of the most unusual cases in the annals of crime
examples: The signing of the Treaty of Rome was the greatest event in the annals of European integration.
Quite whether he will go down in the annals of American history(= be considered)as a great leader remains to be seen.
2used in the titles of official records of events or activities :

children.name: the Annals of the Zoological Society
prehistoric
children.definition: relating to the time in history before anything was written down :
examples: prehistoric burial grounds
prehistoric animals
prehistory[U] the time in history before anything was written down : thời tiền sử
Human prehistory is divided into three successive periods: the Stone Age, the Bronze Age and the Iron Age.

children.name: archaic
children.definition: of or belonging to an ancient period in history: cổ xưa
examples: an archaic system of government
an archaic law/rule/language
archaic civilizations

children.name: modern
children.definition: of the present or recent times,especially the period of history since the Middle Ages (= since1500 AD): hiện đại
examples: Such companies must change if they are to competein the modern world.
The original supermarkets were small by modern standards.

children.name: the modern world
examples: The island has hardly been affected by the modern world.

children.name: modern society
examples: In modern society, elderly relatives rarely live with their children.

children.name: modern times
examples: It was one of the greatest disasters of modern times.

children.name: the modern age/era/period
children.definition: now, rather than in the past
examples: In the modern age, television is the main means of mass communication.

children.name: modern life
examples: These problems are a major part of modern life.

children.name: modern man
children.definition: people today
examples: Modern man gets much less exercise in his daily life than his ancestors.

children.name: modern historyBritish English
children.definition: recent history, as a subject of study
examples: a degree in modern history

children.name: modern languagesBritish English
children.definition: languages that are spoken today, as a subject of study
examples: French, German and other modern languages

children.name: the modern equivalent of sth
children.definition: something with the same importance or purpose as something from the past
examples: In their own minds they are the modern equivalent of highwaymen.

children.name: Modern Greek/Hebrew etc(= the form of the language used today )
historic
children.definition: historic times are the periods of time whose history has been recorded: lịch sử (đã ghi chép)
examples: Extinct volcanoes are those that have not erupted in historic times.

children.name: time
children.definition: / times a particular period in history : thời kì
examples: Mankind has used the horse sinceancient times.

children.name: We sat and talked aboutoldtimes (= things that had happened to us in the past.)
examples: In earlier times, servants would use the bare wooden stairs at the back of the house.

children.name: at/in/during etc the time of sth
examples: He lived at the time of the Napoleonic wars.
In/Duringmedieval times, women thought to be witches were burnt at the stake.

children.name: our time(s)(= the present period in history )
examples: Air pollution has become one of the most significant health problems of our time.
He is widely regarded as one of the best writers ofmodern/ourtimes (= the present or very recent past) .
I never thought it would happeninmy time (= before I died) .

children.name: ancient
children.definition: belonging to a time long ago in history, especially thousands of years agoOPP modern: cổ đại
examples: the ancient civilizations of Asia
ancient Greece/Egypt/Rome
the religion of ancient Egypt
ancient historythe history of ancient societies, such as Greece or Rome :
a professor of ancient history

children.name: a page in history
children.definition: page in/of historyliterary  an important part of the history of a place, time or group of people : trang sử
examples: The signing of the peace treaty will be seen as a glorious page in our country's history.

children.name: history
children.definition: all the things that happened in the past, especially the political, social, or economic development of a nation :
examples: Throughout historythe achievements of women have been largely ignored.
history of
the post-war history of Europe
a decision thatchanged the course of history
American/Chinese/British etc historyIt was one of the worst peacetime disasters in American history.
political/social etc historythe political history of Germany
a period of/in historya glorious period in English history

children.name: recent/modern/contemporary history
examples: The country’s recent history is powerfully told in this film.

children.name: early/ancient history
examples: He had studied ancient Roman history.

children.name: recorded history
children.definition: history since people have written things down
examples: lịch sử được ghi chépThese were the worst floods in recorded history.

children.name: local history
children.definition: the history of events in a particular local area
examples: The building is now a museum of local history.

children.name: human history
children.definition: the history of people rather than the world itself
examples: World War I was the most destructive war in human history up to that time.

children.name: oral history
children.definition: history that is told by speaking and that often consists of personal memories
examples: lịch sử truyền miệngSmith recorded the conversation for oral history.

children.name: rich history
children.definition: an interesting and important history
examples: Greece has a very rich history.

children.name: long history
examples: The 1970s were the most successful in the theatre's long history.

children.name: history shows/tells
children.definition: that
examples: History shows that the usual response to violent protests is repression.

children.name: go down in history
children.definition: be remembered for many years
examples: She will go down in history as one of the greatest tennis players of all time.

children.name: make history
children.definition: do sht important that will be recorded and remembered
examples: Ordinary Berliners made history when they tore down the wall.

children.name: rewrite history
children.definition: change what we believe are the facts about the past
examples: They're trying to rewrite history to exaggerate their role in the war.

children.name: trace the history of sth
children.definition: find out what the history of sth is
examples: James traces the history of modern cricket back to its beginnings in the late 1700s.

children.name: shape history
children.definition: influence events that are recorded
examples: He is one of the politicians who shaped 20th century history.

children.name: the first time in history
children.definition: the first time something has ever happened
examples: For the first time in history, an American president resigned his office.

children.name: change the course of history
children.definition: do sth that has many important effects
examples: Roosevelt and Churchill helped to change the course of history.

children.name: be steeped in history
children.definition: be closely connected with important events in history
examples: Cambridge is steeped in history and tradition.

children.name: consign sth to the dustbin of history
children.definition: to forget about something that existed in the past – used especially when saying that you will feel glad when people have got rid of sth
examples: One day nuclear weapons will be consigned to the dustbin of history.

children.name: history
children.definition: the study of past events as a subject in school or university : môn lịch sử
examples: European/art/economic etc history
a degree in European history
ancient/modern history
a history lesson
historical[usually attri] B1 connected to the study of history
historical evidence/research etc

children.name: history
children.definition: the events that took place from the beginning and during the development of a particular place, activity, institution etc
examples: history of
the worst disaster in the history of space travel
long/brief/75-year etc history
The 1970s were the most successful in the theater’s long history.

children.name: historian
children.definition: sbwho writes about or studies history : nhà viết sử, sử gia

children.name: historic
children.definition: 1a  place or building is very old : lịch sử (lâu đời)
examples: the restoration of historic buildings
ancient historic sites
our historic monuments
2a historic event or act is very important and will be recorded as part of history : lịch sử (quan trọng)
a historic meeting of world leaders
‘It is ahistoric moment,’ he told journalists.
a historic day
3formalhaving taken place or existed in the past : lịch sử
It’s unlikely that the share price will exceed historic levels.

children.name: historical
children.definition: 1relating to the past :

children.name: placesof historical interest
examples: It is important to look at the novel in itshistorical context.
2historical events, facts, people etc happened or existed in the past :
Was King Arthur a real historical figure?
3describing or based on events in the past :

children.name: antique
children.definition: sthmade in an earlier period and collected and valued because it is beautiful, rare, old or of high quality : đồ cổ
examples: You can't give away Granny's old bookcase - it's a valuable antique.
My mothercollectsantiques.
The palace is full of priceless antiques.
antique[adj]trading or relating to antiques:
antique shops/markets/fairs/auctions
They bought the clock at anantique shopin Bath.

children.name: antique[adj]
examples: B1 made in an earlier period and considered to have value because of being beautiful, rare, old, or of high quality:

children.name: anantique dealer
children.definition: sb who buys and sells antiques

children.name: legacy
children.definition: sth that happens or exists as a result of things that happened at an earlier time : di sản
examples: legacy of
The invasionleft a legacyof hatred and fear.
The Greeks have a rich legacyofliterature.
The war has left a legacyofhatred.
legacy from
a legacy from the colonial period
